item.description:
We haven't had a film Meetup in a long time and this one looks interesting.

6:00 PM-Optional potluck pizza and wine/cheese pique-nique or whatever you want to bring starting at 6:00 sur la pelouse juste a coté to the entrance. Other groups are being invited to join us.

Admission is $7

Please reply if you are coming for the pique-nique, film, or both.  Merci

 

Where:

Cinestudio

Map

(Canada, 2010) Directed and written by Denis Villeneuve, based on the stage play by Wajdi Mouawad. Director of photography, André Turpin. Cast: Lubna Azabal, Mélissa Désormeaux-Poulin, Maxime Gaudette, Rémy Girard.

With moviegoers scanning the horizon for films with substance, it seems criminal that Québecois director Denis Villeneuve’s Incendies has been available to so few. The fascinating mystery opens as twins Jeanne and Simon receive their mother’s last request: return to her Middle Eastern homeland to track down their father, and the brother they never knew they had. Accompanied by a deceptively mild mannered notary, they plunge into the passion, prejudices and secrets of their mother’s past. Based on the play by Wajdi Mouawad and shot on location in Québec and Jordan, Incendies won an Academy Award® nomination for Best Foreign Film. “The storytelling in Incendies strikes me as primal the way Greek tragedy is primal. Shattering, cathartic. It is a breathtaking film.” Bob Mondello, NPR
item.how_to_find_us: Outside the door to the movie theater, across the lawn from the chapel. Look for orange lights

group.name: The West Hartford Groupe de French

item.name: Film: Incendies
